title: Documentation says DevServicesContext can be injected in a QuarkusTest
body:
### Describe the bug

In the [testing Dev Services](https://quarkus.io/guides/getting-started-testing#testing-dev-services) documentation, it is said that `io.quarkus.test.common.DevServicesContext` can be injected directly into any @QuarkusTest or @QuarkusIntegrationTest

It seems to me this works in integration test only.

### Expected behavior

Create a test class with `@QuarkusTest` and add a field of type `DevServicesContext` (or implemented `ContextAware`).

The field (or the context-aware method) should be set (or the method invoked).

### Actual behavior

The field (and the context-aware method) is not set (and the method invoked).

It works with `QuarkusIntegrationTest`.

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

Perhaps this is on purpose and in this case the doc should be fixed.

By the way, since the doc says _injected_, it might useful to show an example, because the field shouldn't be annotated with `@Inject`.
